audio_caption: A male speaker begins, stating he will show the listener how to "upload video to Instagram on your PC, Mac or computer," and that it will be "completely free." He mentions that viewers likely searched for this information on YouTube. He notes making "lots of videos" on similar topics, emphasizing the demand for this information. He expresses hope that Instagram will simplify the process, but notes he'll show "a really easy and free way to do it," involving Instagram on PC and Facebook. He urges the viewer to "jump in" with him. Instrumental rock music then starts up, featuring electric guitars and percussion, creating an energetic and driving mood.

A male speaker gives instructions on how to use a phone for "one simple easy step," explaining how to switch to a business account on Instagram to upload videos and posts from a PC. He speaks in an encouraging and friendly tone, even inviting listeners to follow him while they're on the app. Once that's done, he says, "Right then, now we've done that."

The audio clip begins with a male speaker in a friendly tone, introducing the topic of uploading videos using a PC, Mac, or computer. He asks the listener to subscribe and join the community. He then suggests diving in and getting started.

The clip begins with a male speaker explaining the first step, which involves going to Google or a browser and typing in "Instagram Creator Studio" and expecting a Facebook Creator Studio option due to their interconnectedness, prompting the user to click this option to access the Instagram Creator Studio. He then addresses the scenario of needing to sign in with a Facebook or Instagram account if the page prompts one, and clarifies that if the purple bar is absent at the top, the user should switch to the Instagram Creator Studio. The clip concludes with the speaker mentioning Instagram.

A male speaker describes the Instagram platform, specifically the options on the left-hand side, including "calendar," "insights," "monetization," and account switching. He then describes Instagram shop management and focuses on creating posts, noting the options of "Instagram feed" or "IGTV." He says he'll demonstrate the Instagram feed but both options are similar.

The audio clip features a male speaker explaining how to use Instagram on a computer. He speaks in an informative and casual tone, explaining how to put in a description, use hashtags, add emojis and location. He then describes how to upload a video or post, emphasizing the file upload option. The speaker also mentions the limitations of the free computer version, offering Facebook cross-posting as an alternative before highlighting a different method he uses called Later Social.

The clip begins with a male speaker discussing a social media application that handles video uploads, scheduling, and photos. His tone is enthusiastic and informative, emphasizing the program's benefits. He then mentions a discount link in the description for this paid feature and its suitability for serious Instagram users, with its functions including stories, carousels, IGTV, and soon, Reels. The speaker then transitions to thanking the listener for watching and offers additional information. The free method of managing uploads on PC is great but for serious users, Lately Social, linked in the description, is better. He is still speaking enthusiastically in an informative tone.

The audio features a single male speaker with an enthusiastic and encouraging tone, asking the listener to "give me a thumbs up because that means a lot for supporting the channel." He proceeds to wish the listeners a good day and promises to see them in the next video. There are no discernible sounds of music or background noise in the clip.
